column4: Can anyone help me with my wifi troubles/ I cant get it to fetch an IP via DHCP.
a link? overclucker i'm not connected, but i'm trying to
connected/link as in active physical connection.. do "sudo mii-tool"
if there is a link b/w your machine and the router, mii-tool should show it up
oh its ath0. it shows up in ifconfig
oh i see. I'm 'trying' to connect wirelessly
that did the trick, thanks ! So do i have to use that command regularly?
nope.. it should run it when you bootup.. dhclient3 is for wireless
dhclient3 queries the dhcp server thru wireless interface for a dhcp
would have told it right in the beginning if I knew it was wireless ;)
